content:
Trying to download the user manual from https://opencpn.org/OpenCPN/info/downloads.html. However, the http://opencpn.navnux.org/data/doc482.7z link doesn't work for me, seems like a dns problem

Any clue out there?

On a sidenote, this somewhat blocks my work on #3855. Is the archive available somewhere else?
@Pavel Kalian @Dave Register ^
Why? Even if it worked, it would be many years outdated. First of all we need the actual manual.
I tried to create a backup of the wiki, but the download fails at ~520MB every time. Do we have access to the server to get the tarball directly from there?

@Pavel Kalian
FTP creds coming to you by email.
You will find that the Wiki tools and plugins are very buggy. Let me know what you need, I might have already done it.
Generally, doing anything other than simple edits requires a local instance (copy) of the Wiki.
Exactly that is my plan, I'm scared to touch the real thing...

I have put together a script to generate an Antora site from the Dokuwiki data. Not perfect, but does not look that bad. Script at https://github.com/nohal/opencpn-manual, generated site avialable here: https://github.com/nohal/opencpn-manual/releases/download/test-20240916/opencpn-manual-20240916.tar.zst
OK, things are moving. On my side I think I have a first iteration of a new "manuals" plugin ready Real Soon. I'll try to integrate your stuff...

@Pavel Kalian
As I said in the discussion: great work. I did corresponding stuff in the developer manual, and to be honest it was not fun at all. That is, I can feel your pain.

One open question is the long-term user manual maintenance over time. Do you think this solution could work for keeping the manual updated?
Yes, it is not that complicated. It is of course also not perfect, some of the Dokuwiki weirdness is not translated to what it's original authors meant. But overall it is probably manageable.

OK. good to hear. Means that we can leave the Mediawiki user manual as-is for some time. I still think something like Antora is a better long-time solution, but this is a discussion at least I can live without for now.

I plan to make a PR which removes the bundled manuals in the built-in plugins, replacing them with the new plugin which is easier to update. Requires some fiddling with links so user get's the correct feedback if there is no manual installed
